definition: surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites
worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
member of the senior ministerial class (old)/scholar (old)/bachelor/honorific/soldier/noncommissioned officer/specialist worker
to love the common people as one's own children (praise for a virtuous ruler)
Jente township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
to follow admonition as natural flow (idiom); to accept criticism or correction (even from one's inferiors)
expert at appointing people according to their abilities (idiom)/to put the right people in the right places
to appoint people according to their merits (idiom); appointment on the basis of ability and integrity
Lord Menchang of Qi, Chancellor of Qi and of Wei during the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)
famous scholar/worthy/celebrity, esp. distinguished literary person having no official post
